page.title: 03Fords FArm
page.content: Ford's farm is an old property at least 300 years old and still has some fine old farm buildings. The present occupants mainly raise cattle and sheep. Many of the lambs are born during the winter months and graze in the fields until they are old enough to be transferred to another farm for fattening. Similarly, the cattle are fed in the fields but are not transferred. They remain at Ford's Farm until they are ready for slaughter as beef. Crops raised at the farm include some grain, and peas, the latter being used to prepare cattle feed. A recent innovation at Fords Farm has been the introduction of trout breeding The fish are started off in the stream but are later brought into the farm buildings where large tanks have been installed.
